resources.string: \t A data structure is an arrangement of data, either in the computers memory or on the disk storage. Some common examples of data structures include arrays, linked lists, queues, stacks, binary trees, and hash tables.

‚≠êData structures are widely applied in areas such as : 
 1. Compiler design 
 2. operating system 
 3. statistical analysis package 
 4. DBMS 
 5. numerical analysis 
 6. simulation 
 7. Artificial intelligence 
 8. Graphics
\t Data structures play an important role in DBMS. The major data structures used in the network data model are graphs. In the same way, hierarchical data model uses trees and RDBMS uses arrays.

\t Algorithms are used to manipulate the data contained in these data structures, as in searching and sorting. While working with data structures, algorithms are used to insert new data, search for a specified item, and delete a specific item.
